nl.tudelft.simulation.dsol.simulators

Class Simulator<A extends java.lang.Comparable<A>,R extends java.lang.Number & java.lang.Comparable<R>,T extends SimTime<A,R,T>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • nl.tudelft.simulation.event.EventProducer
      • nl.tudelft.simulation.dsol.simulators.Simulator<A,R,T>
  • Type Parameters:
    A - the absolute storage type for the simulation time, e.g. Calendar, Duration, or Double.
    R - the relative type for time storage, e.g. Long for the Calendar. For most non-calendar types, the absolute and relative types are the same.
    T - the extended type itself to be able to implement a comparator on the simulation time.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Runnable, java.rmi.Remote, SimulatorInterface<A,R,T>, nl.tudelft.simulation.event.EventProducerInterface
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DESSSimulator, DEVSSimulator, Simulator.CalendarDouble, Simulator.CalendarFloat, Simulator.CalendarLong, Simulator.TimeDouble, Simulator.TimeDoubleUnit, Simulator.TimeFloat, Simulator.TimeFloatUnit, Simulator.TimeLong

    public abstract class Simulator<A extends java.lang.Comparable<A>,R extends java.lang.Number & java.lang.Comparable<R>,T extends SimTime<A,R,T>>
extends nl.tudelft.simulation.event.EventProducer
implements SimulatorInterface<A,R,T>, java.lang.Runnable
    The Simulator class is an abstract implementation of the SimulatorInterface.

    (c) 2002-2018 Delft University of Technology , the Netherlands.
    See for project information www.simulation.tudelft.nl
    License of use: Lesser General Public License (LGPL) , no warranty.

    Since:
    1.5
    Version:
    $Revision: 1.2 $ $Date: 2010/08/10 11:36:44 $
    Author:
    Peter Jacobs
    See Also:

      • run

        public abstract void run()
        The run method defines the actual time step mechanism of the simulator. The implementation of this method depends on the formalism. Where discrete event formalisms loop over an eventlist continuous simulators take pre-defined time steps.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • start

        public void start(boolean fireStartEvent)
           throws SimRuntimeException
        starts the simulator.
        Specified by:
        start in interface SimulatorInterface<A extends java.lang.Comparable<A>,R extends java.lang.Number & java.lang.Comparable<R>,T extends SimTime<A,R,T>>
        Parameters:
        fireStartEvent - boolean; determine whether to fire a START event that the simulator was started
        Throws:
        SimRuntimeException - whenever starting fails. Possible occasions include starting a started simulator
